text: Island Nights' Entertainments is a book of three short stories by Robert Louis Stevenson. It was published in 1893.The Letters of Robert Louis Stevenson. Volume Seven, September 1890 - December 1892. Bradford A. Booth and Ernest Mehew (Editors). Yale University Press. ISBN 978-0-300-06213-7 It is also known as South Sea Tales. The stories are "The Beach of Fales√°", "The Bottle Imp", and "The Isle of Voices". The book was one of the last books Stevenson wrote. He died in 1894. ==References== Category:1893 books Category:Books by Robert Louis Stevenson Category:British short stories
title: Island Nights' Entertainments
